definitions.definition: To be strong; to have power (over).
(modal auxiliary verb, defective) To have permission to, be allowed. Used in granting permission and in questions to make polite requests.
definitions.example: you may smoke outside;  may I sit there?

definitions.definition: (modal auxiliary verb, defective) Expressing a present possibility; possibly.
definitions.example: he may be lying;  Schrödinger's cat may or may not be in the box

definitions.definition: (subjunctive present, defective) Expressing a wish (with present subjunctive effect).
definitions.example: may you win;  may the weather be sunny

definitions.definition: Used in modesty, courtesy, or concession, or to soften a question or remark.
To gather may, or flowers in general.
